comments:
Here's the code in the MapEditModel constructor where I do this:

public MapEditModel(String editModelID, EMFWorkbenchContext context, boolean 
readOnly, EJBArtifactEdit ae, String backendID) {
	super(editModelID, context, readOnly, ModuleURIUtil.fullyQualifyURI
(ae.getComponentHandle()));
	
	this.backendid = backendID;
	this.artifactEdit = ae;
	resetKnownResourceUris();
	processLoadedResources();
	
	getEjbXmiResource().setBatchMode(false);
}
public EJBResource getEjbXmiResource() {
	return (EJBResource) getResource(J2EEConstants.EJBJAR_DD_URI_OBJ);
}

Noting EJBResourceImpl.setBatchMode():
public void setBatchMode(boolean isBatch) {
	renderer.setBatchMode(isBatch);
}


When running in headless mode, there isn't a problem, and 'renderer' is an 
instance of EMF2DOMRenderer... in the GUI, 'renderer' is an instance of 
EMF2DomSedRenderer, and the following exception occurs:

Is this a problem in the renderer or the way I'm setting things up?

This part 
"java.lang.IllegalStateException: Program Error: modelStateChanging was less 
than zero"
Comes from our code. it is a sign that a client called 'modelChanged()' on our
model but there has been no preceding, matching, 'aboutToChangeModel() call.
They always have to be paired to work. Up until a few weeks ago, we just wrote
message to the log in this condition, but felt that was not sufficicient, since
can leave things in a bad state, so changed to throw illegal state execaption. 

Let me know if I can help further.
Fix released, will be available in the next integration build
